conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true cutaway 3D model: walls have height and thickness, multiple faces are visible, interior volumes read as rooms, and the camera is angled (not orthographic top-down).

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Strong 3D extrusion with clear wall thickness and readable room volumes; clean cutaway with minimal geometry breakage. Minor simplification of some wall corner/angled details.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall layout matches: living/kitchen/nook left, master suite top-right, bedrooms along right, bedroom #4 bottom-center, study bottom-left, large 2-car garage bottom-right, patios shown as exterior slabs. Some proportional and partition simplifications (not all small jogs/angles from the 2D plan appear exact).

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture present and generally placed in correct rooms (living seating, dining table, beds). Kitchen counters/appliances and bathroom fixtures are represented; a few secondary/service elements (e.g., utility/laundry detail) appear simplified.

visual_clarity.notes: Walls/floors/openings are clearly distinguishable with consistent materials; interior visibility is good. Slight uniformity/simplicity in materials reduces structural contrast, but geometry remains readable.

detected_errors.description: Minor layout/proportion drift and simplification of some angled/jogged wall segments (notably around the master suite and some interior partitions) compared to the 2D plan.
Door/window quantity and exact placement appear generally consistent but not perfectly verifiable; some openings likely simplified relative to the 2D plan.
Service/utility details and some room-specific furnishings are simplified; not all secondary fixtures/cabinets shown in the 2D plan are explicitly modeled.

summary: A true cutaway 3D conversion with strong overall layout fidelity and readable interiors, with minor proportional/partition and opening-detail simplifications versus the 2D plan.
